content.question: A chi-square test of independence was conducted to investigate whether there is an association between the location where a person lives in a city (north, south, east, or west) and who the person planned to vote for in the upcoming mayoral election (the incumbent or the challenger). A random sample of 100 potential voters was selected, and the hypothesis test had a chi-square test statistic of <math alttext="chi square equals 9.84" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>Ï‡</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>9.84</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> with a <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.02. Which of the following statements is the correct interpretation of the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value in context?

choices.label: There is a 2 percent chance that where a person lives and who that person plans to vote for are independent.
There is a 2 percent chance that where a person lives and who that person plans to vote for are dependent.
There is a 2 percent chance of making a Type <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error.
Assuming that the location of where a person lives and who that person plans to vote for are dependent, there is a 2 percent chance of finding a test statistic that is 9.84 or greater.
Assuming that the location of where a person lives and who that person plans to vote for are independent, there is a 2 percent chance of finding a test statistic that is 9.84 or greater.

content.answer: Assuming that the location of where a person lives and who that person plans to vote for are independent, there is a 2 percent chance of finding a test statistic that is 9.84 or greater.

topic.text: 8.6: Carrying Out a Chi-Square Test for Homogeneity or Independence

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
